articles.author: Phuong Nguyen, Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin praised Vietnam for its "balanced" stance on the Ukraine war and listed progress on payments, energy and trade in an opinion piece published on Wednesday in the newspaper of Vietnam's Communist Party.
articles.title: Russia's Putin praises Vietnam for its stance on Ukraine

articles.author: Josh Smith, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Shortly after North Korean leader Kim Jong Un embraced Russian Vladimir Putin on his arrival at Pyongyang's airport on Wednesday, the two leaders shared their "pent-up inmost thoughts" and agreed to develop their nations' relations, North Korean state media said.
articles.title: Putin and Kim embrace in North Korea, vow new multi-polar world

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks backed by warplanes and drones advanced deeper into the western part of the Gaza Strip city of Rafah on Wednesday, killing eight people, according to residents and Palestinian medics.
articles.title: Israeli tanks push deeper into Rafah, forcing people to flee again

articles.author: Kristina Cooke, Ted Hesson
articles.description: When news broke of U.S. President Joe Biden’s plan to provide a path to citizenship for certain immigrants who entered the country illegally and are married to U.S. citizens, Pennsylvania-based immigration lawyer Bridget Cambria didn’t need long to think of clients it could help.
articles.title: Biden policy is welcome relief for Americans with spouses in the country illegally

articles.author: Jonathan Saul
articles.description: Urgent action must be taken in the Red Sea to stop attacks on merchant shipping by Yemen's Houthis, leading industry groups said on Wednesday, after the sinking of a second ship.
articles.title: Shipping industry urges Red Sea action as Houthis sink second vessel

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Josh Smith
articles.description: Vladimir Putin, on his first visit to North Korea in 24 years, signed a mutual defence pledge with Kim Jong Un on Wednesday, underscoring just how far Russia has recast its relations with the only country to test a nuclear weapon this century.
articles.title: With defence pledge, Putin makes shift towards North Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rishi Sunak is forecast to become the first sitting British prime minister to lose their own parliamentary seat at an election, a Savanta opinion poll published by the Telegraph newspaper ahead of the July 4 national vote showed.
articles.title: UK PM Sunak forecast to lose his parliamentary seat, Savanta poll shows

articles.author: Siyabonga Sishi, Thando Hlophe
articles.description: A weakened South African President Cyril Ramaphosa pledged on Wednesday that his new multi-party government would work to improve basic living conditions for all citizens as he was sworn in for a second term in office.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa vows to fight inequality as power-sharing begins

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday asked schools to hold a "discussion hour" on racism and antisemitism this week, after the rape of a Jewish girl in a Paris suburb added to France's charged social climate ahead of elections.
articles.title: Macron demands schools address antisemitism after Jewish girl raped

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court has upheld a 12-year guilty verdict for treason against a physicist accused of passing secrets about hypersonic technology to the Netherlands, a Russian legal association said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russian court upholds physicist's 12-year treason sentence
